title: java 0.76 extension link not working in DockerFile

labels.name: stale
labels.description: Awaiting input from creator for prolonged time period

body:
<!--
Thanks for reporting a bug 🙌 ❤️

Before opening a new issue, please make sure that we do not have any duplicates already open. You can ensure this by searching the issue list for this repository. If there is a duplicate, please close your issue and add a comment to the existing issue instead. Also, be sure to check our documentation first: https://github.com/ml-tooling/ml-workspace
-->

**Describe the bug:**
In Dockerfile (Ubuntu20 branch) line 884..link not working anymore.
wget --retry-on-http-error=429 --waitretry 15 --tries 5 --no-verbose https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/_apis/public/gallery/publishers/redhat/vsextensions/java/$VS_JAVA_VERSION/vspackage

<!-- Describe your issue, but please be descriptive! Thanks again 🙌 ❤️ -->

**Expected behaviour:**
Act fails when it reaches to download the java 0.76 version.
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->

**Steps to reproduce the issue:**
act -b -j build
<!-- include screenshots, logs, code or other info to help explain your problem -->

<!-- 
1. Go to '...'
2. Click on '....'
3. Scroll down to '....'
4. See error
-->

**Technical details:**

- Workspace version <!-- run `echo $WORKSPACE_VERSION` inside the workspace -->: n/a
- Docker version <!-- run `docker version` on host machine -->: n/a
- Host Machine OS (Windows/Linux/Mac): n/a
- Command used to start the workspace <!-- e.g. `docker run mltooling/ml-workspace:latest` -->: n/a
- Browser (Chrome/Firefox/Safari): n/a

**Possible Fix:**
New link: 
https://download.jboss.org/jbosstools/jdt.ls/staging/java-0.76.0-61.vsix
<!--- Not obligatory, but suggest a fix or reason for the bug -->

**Additional context:**

<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->
